Fungal Infection.advice: Keep the affected area clean and dry. Avoid sharing personal items. Wear breathable fabrics.

Allergy.advice: Avoid known allergens and keep your environment clean to minimize exposure.

GERD.advice: Eat smaller meals, avoid lying down immediately after eating, and reduce intake of fatty foods, caffeine, and alcohol.

Chronic Cholestasis.advice: Follow a low-fat diet, avoid alcohol, and manage itching by keeping the skin cool and moisturized.

Drug Reaction.advice: Discontinue the offending drug under medical supervision. Avoid re-exposure to the drug.

Peptic Ulcer Disease.advice: Avoid foods and beverages that irritate the stomach lining. Quit smoking and reduce stress.

AIDS.advice: Follow a healthy diet, get regular exercise, and avoid exposure to infections.

Diabetes.advice: Maintain a healthy diet, regular physical activity, and monitor blood glucose levels.

Gastroenteritis.advice: Stay hydrated. Rest and consume a bland diet as tolerated.

Bronchial Asthma.advice: Avoid triggers, such as allergens and smoke. Use an air purifier.

Hypertension.advice: Regular physical activity, maintaining a healthy weight, limiting alcohol, and eating a diet rich in fruits and vegetables can help manage blood pressure.

Migraine.advice: Avoid triggers, maintain a regular sleep schedule, and stay hydrated.

Cervical Spondylosis.advice: Maintain good posture, stay active, and do neck-strengthening exercises.

Paralysis (Brain Hemorrhage).advice: Rehabilitation therapy is critical for recovery. Follow a healthy lifestyle to prevent further incidents.

Jaundice.advice: Rest, drink fluids, and eat healthy foods. Avoid alcohol and unnecessary medications.
medications: Depending on the underlying cause: antivirals, antibiotics, or other specific treatments

Malaria.advice: Use mosquito repellent and sleep under insecticide-treated mosquito nets.

Chicken Pox.advice: Stay hydrated and rest. Use calamine lotion for itching.

Dengue.advice: Rest, drink plenty of fluids, and take paracetamol for pain and fever. Avoid aspirin.

Typhoid.advice: Maintain hydration and eat a healthy diet. Follow good hygiene practices.

Hepatitis A.advice: Rest, eat a well-balanced diet, and avoid alcohol. Practice good hygiene.

Hepatitis B.advice: Maintain a healthy diet, avoid alcohol, and monitor liver function regularly.

Hepatitis C.advice: Avoid alcohol and follow a healthy lifestyle. Regular monitoring of liver function.

Hepatitis D.advice: Avoid alcohol and ensure a balanced diet. Hepatitis B vaccination is also recommended.

Hepatitis E.advice: Maintain hydration and follow good personal hygiene practices.
medications: Rest and hydration; no specific treatment required

Alcoholic Hepatitis.advice: Abstain from alcohol, eat a healthy diet, and consider joining a support group.

Tuberculosis.advice: Ensure good ventilation in living spaces, wear a mask if you're infectious, and follow a nutritious diet.

Common Cold.advice: Stay well-hydrated, rest, and keep warm. Using a humidifier can help relieve congestion and lubricate your throat.

Pneumonia.advice: Rest, stay hydrated, and avoid smoking. Keep warm and avoid cold environments.

Dimorphic Hemorrhoids (Piles).advice: Eat a high-fiber diet, drink plenty of fluids, and use over-the-counter hemorrhoid creams.

Heart Attack.advice: Follow a heart-healthy diet, exercise regularly, and avoid smoking. Monitor blood pressure and cholesterol.

Varicose Veins.advice: Exercise regularly, elevate your legs when resting, and avoid standing or sitting for long periods.
medications: sclerotherapy or surgery in severe cases

Hypothyroidism.advice: Take thyroid hormone replacement as prescribed. Maintain a balanced diet and regular exercise.

Hypoglycemia.advice: Eat small, frequent meals throughout the day. Carry a source of fast-acting glucose.

Osteoarthritis.advice: Maintain a healthy weight, stay active, and use heat or cold therapy to ease pain.

Arthritis.advice: Engage in regular physical activity, maintain a healthy weight, and use hot or cold therapy to reduce pain.

Vertigo (Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo).advice: Perform specific head and neck movements known as Epley or Semont maneuvers. Avoid sudden head movements.

Acne.advice: Gently clean the skin with mild soap, avoid excessive washing and touching your face, and use non-comedogenic products.

Urinary Tract Infection (UTI).advice: Increase fluid intake, particularly water, to help flush out bacteria from the urinary system.

Psoriasis.advice: Keep your skin moisturized. Avoid triggers that can cause flare-ups, such as stress and smoking.

Impetigo.advice: Keep the infected area clean and covered. Avoid scratching or touching the sores.
medications: oral antibiotics for more severe cases

COVID-19.advice: Wear masks in crowded places, maintain social distancing, and practice good hand hygiene. Vaccination is recommended.

Color Blindness.advice: There's no cure, but visual aids like colored filters or lenses can help manage the condition.

Refractive Errors.advice: Regular eye examinations. Use prescribed glasses or contact lenses. Consider refractive surgery for a permanent solution.

Age-Related Macular Degeneration.advice: Regular eye exams, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and consider taking specific dietary supplements.

Cataract.advice: Regular eye exams and use of sunglasses to protect eyes from UV light. Surgery is the only effective treatment.

Diabetic Retinopathy.advice: Control blood sugar, blood pressure, and cholesterol levels. Regular eye exams are essential.

Glaucoma.advice: Regular eye exams. Use prescribed eye drops to reduce eye pressure. Surgery may be necessary.

Amblyopia.advice: Use of corrective lenses, eye patches, or vision therapy exercises to improve visual acuity.

Strabismus.advice: Eye exercises, glasses, or surgery may be recommended to align the eyes properly.

Bladder Cancer.advice: Follow up with regular cystoscopies. Avoid tobacco. Stay hydrated.

Breast Cancer.advice: Maintain a healthy lifestyle, reduce alcohol intake, and perform regular self-exams. Follow prescribed treatment plans.

Colorectal Cancer.advice: Eat a diet high in fruits, vegetables, and fiber. Get regular screenings as recommended.

Kidney Cancer.advice: Follow a healthy lifestyle and avoid exposure to toxins. Surgery is the primary treatment.

Lung Cancer - Non-Small Cell.advice: Avoid smoking and exposure to secondhand smoke and pollutants. Follow the treatment plan closely.

Lymphoma - Non-Hodgkin.advice: Maintain a balanced diet and regular exercise. Follow the treatment plan provided by your healthcare provider.

Melanoma.advice: Protect your skin from UV radiation. Perform regular skin checks and follow up on any changes.

Oral and Oropharyngeal Cancer.advice: Avoid tobacco and excessive alcohol use. Maintain good oral hygiene.

Dental Caries (Tooth Decay).advice: Maintain good oral hygiene, reduce sugary food intake, and visit the dentist regularly for check-ups.

Periodontal (Gum) Disease.advice: Brush and floss daily. Regular dental cleanings and check-ups.

Edentulism (Total Tooth Loss).advice: Consider dental implants or dentures. Maintain good oral hygiene to protect remaining oral structures.

Cleft Lip and Palate.advice: Surgical intervention is usually required. Speech therapy may be necessary.

Oro-Dental Trauma.advice: Protect teeth during sports and recreational activities. Seek immediate dental care for injuries.

Noma.advice: Immediate medical treatment is necessary. Maintain good oral hygiene and nutrition.

Acoustic Neuroma.advice: Regular monitoring and avoiding exposure to loud noises. Surgical or non-surgical treatments based on size and symptoms.

Deafness.advice: Use hearing aids or cochlear implants as recommended. Protect ears from loud noises.

Earache.advice: Keep the ear dry and avoid inserting objects. Use over-the-counter pain relief if necessary.

Ear Infection.advice: Avoid water from entering the ear. Use warm compresses for relief.

Ear Wax.advice: Avoid using cotton swabs inside the ear. Use over-the-counter drops to soften the wax.
medications: manual removal by a professional if necessary

Fluid from the Ear.advice: Keep the ear dry and clean. Avoid inserting anything into the ear canal.

Glue Ear.advice: Most cases resolve on their own. Avoid smoke and allergens. Surgery may be necessary for persistent cases.

Hearing Loss.advice: Use hearing protection in noisy environments. Consider using hearing aids or other assistive devices.
